page.title: 04MORTEHOE METHODIST CHURCH
page.content: Mortehoe Methodist Church at the top of Chapel Hill was constructed of local stone and opened in 1901. Rev. Thomas Rees laid the foundation stone and a fine stained glass window ws erected in his memory. The original organ purchased in memory of the men who died in the First World War is still in use today. Mortehoe Methodist Church is included in the Ilfracombe Circuit with the Superintendent Minister residing in Ilfracombe. As the Methodist Ministry is of an itinerant nature this involves a changeover of ministers every 5-8 years. The present membership is 12.
